RESOURCE.STRING: The Aftertreatment High NOx Reset test is used to determine if the engine is operating within the correct limits to allow the reset to complete. It is necessary to drive or operate the vehicle on a chassis dynamometer in order to validate the repair and for the fault codes 1694, 2772 and 2773 to go inactive. INSITE is used to monitor the engine to determine when the conditions are met for the fault code(s) to go inactive and turn off the MIL lamp.

"Initial Conditions:
1. Fault code(s) identified and corrected
2. Key switch is on
3. Engine running at normal operating temperatures

Steps:
1. Press the Start button
2. Start the drive cycle
3. Raise and maintain Engine Speed at 1000 to 2500 RPM
4. Increase Engine Speed to raise Catalyst Solution Injection Rate to at least 100%
5. Drive until Catalyst Inlet Temperature and Catalyst Outlet Temperature are high enough to enable dosing to occur
6. When these required conditions are met, the progress bar will change colors indicating that the test has started


Additional Information:
1. If any of the monitored parameter values fall outside the required values during test operation, the operation will pause. The values must be reestablished before the Timer will restart.
2. Maintain engine speed, engine load and throttle position for a minimum of 35 seconds. When the reset runs and passes, the MIL lamp will turn off. If the MIL lamp does not turn off, continue operating at the steady state conditions for an additional three minutes.
3. If the operation is successful, the MIL lamp will turn off. "

NOTE: The NOx reset can potentially run in the ECM without the assistance of INSITE. The feature could start in INSITE partially completed. This is not a fault or problem with INSITE. The feature could also fail to run in INSITE due to already being run in the ECM during the current keycycle. The feature is capable of being run either with or without INSITE only one time during a keycycle.
All conditions have been met for the ECM to run the test. Please do not change any conditions until the test completes.
The Catalyst Solution Injection Rate is less than 100 percent. Please increase engine speed to raise the Catalyst Solution Injection Rate to the required value.
The engine is stopped. Please start the engine and restart the test.
The Aftertreatment High NOx Reset test was stopped because the engine has stopped. Please start the engine and restart the test.
Engine speed is below the low speed limit. Please increase engine speed above 1000 rpm.
Engine speed has exceeded the test limit. Please reduce engine speed to less than 2500 rpm.
The NOx Monitor and this test are not supported in the current calibration.
The test will run when all initial conditions are set
Engine Speed is within the speed limit
The Catalyst Solution Injection Rate is equal to 100 percent
This feature has run during this key cycle. Please key off for 30 seconds to reset this feature.
Catalyst temperatures are below minimum required for dosing. Please increase speed or load on the engine.
Catalyst temperatures are high enough to support dosing
Please increase speed or load on the engine to start the High NOx Reset monitor.
